job.title: Software Engineer I
job.description: strongWhy Join Intellia brbrstrongOur mission is to develop curative genome editing treatments that can positively transform the lives of people living with severe and lifethreatening diseasesbrbrBeyond our science we live our four core values One Explore Disrupt Deliver and feel strongly that you can achieve more at Intellia We have a singleminded determination to excel and succeed together We believe in the power of curiosity and pushing boundaries We welcome challenging thoughts and imagination to develop innovative solutions And we know that patients are counting on us to make the promise a reality so we must maintain high standards and get it donebrbrWe want all of our people to go beyond what is possible We arent constrained by typical end rails and we arent out to just treat people Were all in this for something more Were driven to cure and motivated for change Just imagine the possibilities of what we can do togetherbrbrstronguHow You Will Achieve More With IntelliabrbrustrongAs a Software Engineer I you will join our Informatics Software group where we develop software using the best technologies to solve the needs of the RampD laboratory users We are seeking an individual who is interested in developing software solutions to streamline laboratory processes With the increasing amount of data generated by researchers it is our responsibility as software engineers to provide solutions to streamline their work When the laboratory succeeds we succeed While enabling the progress of cuttingedge science this is also an opportunity to learn the latest and greatest software development patterns and practices Other main responsibilities includebrulliWork with laboratory users to implement and test new workflowsliliWrite documentation and help users with issuesliliDevelop APIs to expose data for services and websitesliliDesign frontend web pages for laboratory users to complete workflowsliliCollaborate with scientific stakeholders to create or modify requirements defining software servicesliliDeploy solutions to cloud infrastructure via CICD pipelinesbrliulstronguAbout YoubrbrustrongAre you a Software Engineer who is interested in building software to help others The ideal candidate will have a BSMS in Computer Science or a related field Experience in the biotech industry is a plus but not required if skills and enthusiasm are aligned We currently work as a team in a hybrid work environment You should feel comfortable working on your own in such an environment To support you we utilize online project management and source control to delegate and accomplish our development needsbrbrstronguSkills And Technologies You Should Be Familiar With IncludebrustrongulliPython or related programming languageliliHTML and JavaScriptliliGit and source control systemsliliSQL and interacting with database systemsliliScripting in Linux and Windows EnvironmentsbrliulIn addition to the above skills experience you will also interact with the following technologiesbrulliExperience working with LIMS or Laboratory SoftwareliliLaboratory Automation Liquid handlers Plate readers Dispensers etcliliAWSliliORMliliVuejsbrliulstrongMeet your future team brbrstrongThe Informatics team members typically fit in two categories bioinformaticists and software engineers The bioinformaticists are responsible for ensuring data integrity and quality while also maintaining the development of genomic pipelines The software engineers are responsible for developing services and portals for endusers as well as managing cloudbased infrastructure We also utilize several domainspecific contractors who remotely on our team to provide additional resources for development Together the informatics team provides critical support and design services for the RampD laboratorybrbrWe are primarily remote with the occasional visit to the laboratory when onsite testing is required By utilizing modern development methodologies and remote conferencing tools we have maintained a high level of productivity and software delivery If you join our team you can expect to join a fast fun exciting and collaborative environment We look forward to fostering your skills learning from your experiences and building amazing software togetherbrbremEEOC Statement Intellia believes in a diverse environment and is committed to equal employment opportunity for all its employees and qualified applicants We do not discriminate in recruitment hiring training promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race color religion gender national origin age sexual orientation marital or veteran status disability or any other legally protected status Intellia will make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with known disabilities in accordance with applicable lawem
